messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] re: dealing with relatives
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/22/2004 2:46:36 PM Central Standard Time, ... Maybe she just needs to set some goals ;) Laura [Non-text portions of this message have been
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/22/2004 2:46:36 PM Central Standard Time,
mamabethuscg@... writes:


> I've asked my mother, and she says she just hasn't gotten to it yet..she's
> been "soooo busy with work and everything."

Maybe she just needs to set some goals ;)

Laura

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] re: dealing with relatives
messages.msgSnippet: I ve asked my mother, and she says she just hasn t gotten to it yet..she s been soooo busy with work and everything. I wish it was just the mail. MamaBeth
messages.messageBody:
I've asked my mother, and she says she just hasn't gotten to it yet..she's been "soooo busy with work and everything."

I wish it was just the mail.

MamaBeth

SandraDodd@... wrote:

In a message dated 2/21/04 10:10:11 PM, mamabethuscg@... writes:

<< Sarah did send a handwritten letter to Paul's mother, who has written her
back. She's still emailing, but thankfully hasn't brought up the fact that my
mother hasn't written. >>

There's a slight possibility it didn't arrive. I've had three mail failures
in the past year, after a life time of maybe that many altogether.
Coincidence, maybe. Holly never got her birthday card with $12 check for her 12th
birthday. The grandparents say it was sent. I said we'll wait a while and see
if it shows. It never has. I don't want to send them the bill for $12 worth
of expected birthday money. <g>

Sandra

messages.subject: re: dealing with relatives
messages.msgSnippet: Someone was asking about dealing with relatives who interfere or disapprove of unschooling...there was a thread awhile back because my mother was asking that
messages.messageBody:
Someone was asking about dealing with relatives who interfere or disapprove of unschooling...there was a thread awhile back because my mother was asking that my daughter Sarah, age 7, NOT email her as Sarah prefers but hand write her a letter. Sarah did agree to it, but there was a big go around between my mother and I over it and unschooling.

I just thought I'd post that it's been some two months now I think...maybe just six weeks...and my mother has STILL not written Sarah back.

Sarah did send a handwritten letter to Paul's mother, who has written her back. She's still emailing, but thankfully hasn't brought up the fact that my mother hasn't written.

MamaBeth
